event.name: AddedItemToCart
event.summary: Holds information about what the user added to their shopping cart.

producers.name: Basket Service
producers.summary: CRUD based API to handle Basket interactions for users of the shopping website.

publishes.name: AddedItemToCart
publishes.summary: Holds information about what the user added to their shopping cart.

publishes.name: OrderRequested
publishes.summary: Holds information about the customers order.

publishes.name: RemovedItemFromCart
publishes.summary: Holds information about what the user removed from their cart.

consumers.name: Data Lake
consumers.summary: Our internal datalake used by the data team and business analytics.

subscribes.name: AddedItemToCart
subscribes.summary: Holds information about what the user added to their shopping cart.

subscribes.name: OrderComplete
subscribes.summary: Event represents when an order has been complete. (Delivered and finished)

subscribes.name: RemovedItemFromCart
subscribes.summary: Holds information about what the user removed from their cart.

subscribes.name: ShipmentDelivered
subscribes.summary: Event represents when a shipment has been delievered and received.

markdown.content:
<Admonition>When firing this event make sure you set the `correlation-id` in the headers. Our schemas have standard metadata make sure you read and follow it.</Admonition>

### Details

This event can be triggered multiple times per customer. Everytime the customer adds an item to their shopping cart this event will be triggered.

We have a frontend application that allows users to buy things from our store. This front end interacts directly with the `Basket Service` to add items to the cart. The `Basket Service` will raise the events.


### Consumer / Producer Diagram

<Mermaid />

<Schema />
